snippet: Col. Jefferson Davis passed here this morning on his way to his plantation, in the lower part of the county. Some four or five weeks since, he started to canvass the northern portion of the State, in defense of the principles of the Southern Right...
lead_paragraph: Col. Jefferson Davis passed here this morning on his way to his plantation, in the lower part of the county. Some four or five weeks since, he started to canvass the northern portion of the State, in defense of the principles of the Southern Rights Party; but, after filing but a small part of his appointments. he was struck down by discase, from which he has yet but partially recovered.

headline.main: Politics in Mississippi--Col Jeflerson Davis; From The New-Orleans Delta.

abstract: His stumping closed by sudden illness
